revised_title: Freeze-Fracturing of Presynaptic Membranes in the Central Nervous System
tldr: The authors used freeze-fracturing techniques to study the presynaptic membranes in the central nervous system. They discovered synaptopores, which are small structures that may serve as attachment sites for synaptic vesicles. This research suggests that neurotransmitter release may occur through a different mechanism than previously thought, involving a close relationship between vesicles and the presynaptic membrane.
